page.title: 03FARMING NEAR SITTINGBOURNE 2
page.content: Wilford Court farm's most important crop is strawberries. The farm employs 250 casual labourers to harvest the fruit. It is then stored in a cool room before being sent to the supermarkets and London wholesale fruit markets. The farm also produces apples and pears. Each fruit tree is only about two metres tall and is shaped like an A to ensure that each fruit gets as much sunlight as possible. This also makes harvesting an easy task. Bax Farm is one part of a very large area of land owned by one farmer. His farm produces apples, pears, plums, cherries, peas, hops, wheat and potatoes. He also grows oil seed rape which is used to make vegetable oil. To protect the crops they are sprayed with 7 tonnes of pesticide per acre. This is vital to ensure healthy crops.
